alert.note: Alert for Meade; Pennington (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 23 at 9:07PM MDT until June 24 at 3:00AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: The National Weather Service in Rapid City has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Meade County in west central South Dakota... Northeastern Pennington County in west central South Dakota... * Until 300 AM MDT. * At 907 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 4 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, county roads as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Union Center, Elm Springs, Hereford, Curlew Lake and Viewfield and drainages into Elk Creek and the Belle Fourche River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
